definition[0]: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
example[0]: He was a pioneer in the field of biotechnology.
example[1]: John Whitney was a pioneer of computer animation.
definition[1]: one of the first people to travel to a new country or area and begin living there, farming etc
example[2]: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
definition[2]: to be the first person to do, invent, or use something
example[3]: The new cancer treatment was pioneered in the early eighties by Dr Sylvia Bannerjee.
definition[3]: the first person or organization to do something that other people and organizations later develop or continue to do
example[4]: pioneers willing to try a new software product and lead others to it
example[5]: Victor Co. of Japan, pioneer of the videocassette recorder
example[6]: Kentucky Fried Chicken, one of the pioneers in the fast-food business
